reviewText: CLASSIC LITERATURE ON FILM (from Brentwood Home Entertainment) consists of cinematic treatments of well-known fiction. These ten video titles are adaptations of Thackeray, Bronte, Maugham, Fitzgerald and others. CLASSIC LITERATURE ON FILM is certain to please vintage movie melodrama fans, and all readers of famous novelists. The stories of another major author (plus a few screen translations starring his characters) are available on Brentwood's DVD set, SHERLOCK HOLMES: CASE FILES. . The following alphabetized program list provides viewer poll ratings for each film (based on a 1 to 10 scale), plus original theatrical titles (where indicated), years of release and principal actors. (6.2) Becky Sharp (1935) - Miriam Hopkins/Cedric Hardwicke/Billie Burke/Nigel Bruce (7.4) Cyrano de Bergerac (1950) - José Ferrer/Mala Powers (6.5) A Farewell To Arms (1932) - Gary Cooper/Helen Hayes/Adolphe Menjou (6.7) Jane Eyre (UK/USA-TV-1970) - George C. Scott/Susannah York/Jack Hawkins (5.9) The Last Of The Belles ("F. Scott Fitzgerald and 'The Last of the Belles'") (TV-1974) - Richard Chamberlain/Blythe Danner/Susan Sarandon (7.2) Of Human Bondage (1934) - Leslie Howard/Bette Davis/Reginald Denny/Alan Hale (5.7) Oliver Twist (1933) - Dickie Moore/Irving Pichel/William 'Stage' Boyd (6.3) Snows Of Kilimanjaro (1952) - Gregory Peck/Susan Hayward/Ava Gardner/Leo G. Carroll/Benny Carter (alto sax solo-uncredited) (4.9) Studs Lonigan (1960) - Christopher Knight/Frank Gorshin/Jack Nicholson (5.9) Whistle Stop (1946) - George Raft/Ava Gardner/Victor McLaglen
